rime noun
(FROST)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C or U ] mainly literary frost (= the thin, white layer of ice that forms when the air temperature is below the freezing point of water, especially outside at night): There was a strong rime on all vegetation. The windows were wet where the rime had melted.
More examplesFewer examplesThe ground was hard and the rime thick and crisp on the grass. A frosty rime was on his head, and on his eyebrows.One morning big dry snowflakes starred the rime on the sill.
